me.normanmaurer.niosmtp
Class SMTPByteArrayMessage

java.lang.Object
  me.normanmaurer.niosmtp.SMTPByteArrayMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
SMTPMessage
Direct Known Subclasses:
SMTPByteArrayMessageImpl
public abstract class SMTPByteArrayMessage
extends Object
implements SMTPMessage

Abstract base implementation of SMTPMessage which allows to access the raw byte array of the SMTPMessage. This should only be used if you are sure that the whole SMTPMessage fit into memory. The get7BitAsByteArray() and get8BitAsByteArray() methods can be used by the Transport implementation for better performing write operations.

Author:
Norman Maurer

get7bit

public InputStream get7bit()
                    throws IOException
Description copied from interface: SMTPMessage
This method is getting called if the SMTP-Server does not support the 8BITMIME extension.

This method MAY return the same InputStream on every call, so it should only be used to consume the stream once.

Specified by:
get7bit in interface SMTPMessage
Returns:
7bit
Throws:

get8Bit

public InputStream get8Bit()
                    throws IOException
Description copied from interface: SMTPMessage
This method is getting called if the SMTP-Server supports the 8BITMIME extension.

This method MAY return the same InputStream on every call, so it should only be used to consume the stream once.

The returned InputStream is not expected to be "raw content" . It cannot include "null" bytes and must be composed of "lines" separated by CRLF and not longer than 998 bytes.

Specified by:
get8Bit in interface SMTPMessage
Returns:
convertedMsg
Throws:
IOException
